title: Application settings
content:
The solution provides default settings for various applications. To customize the settings, select Administration > Configuration > Application Settings from the main menu. Users with admin privileges or roles that can access Application settings can modify the settings.

To access the mobile app settings, select Mobile App Settings from the top tab bar. See Mobile app settings. 

Under Application Settings, you can edit the following settings.

In-line translation tool

In-line translation is disabled by default. To enable this function, follow these steps:

  1. In the In-line translation tool field, select On.
  2. Select the external tool that you want to use to perform the translation. Currently, Google Translate and Microsoft Translator are supported. You must purchase a license for one of these services to use this functionality.
    For Microsoft Translator, you also need to enter the region ID if you consume the regional translator resource. For example, westus or westus2. You can leave the region ID blank if you consume the global translator resource.
  3. Click Save.

  • If you enable this setting, some content of web pages will be sent to Google or Microsoft when using the translation tool.

  • OpenText encourages the customer to follow Google’s or Microsoft's security requirements for setting API keys, which is not provided by OpenText. By not implementing these security guidelines, you may be exposing the system to increased security risks. You understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same. It remains at all times the Customer’s sole responsibility to assess its own regulatory and business requirements. OpenText does not represent or warrant that its products comply with any specific legal or regulatory standards applicable to Customer in conducting Customer's business.

Tenant key chain

You can create, update, or restore your key chain to support encrypted fields in the tenant. You must set up your tenant key chain to encrypt the data entered in the encrypted field.

The encrypted fields usually contain sensitive data, such as user options using the Encrypted String field type and the passwords for an aggregation provider on the provider configuration page.

The passcode of the key chain must be 14 to 20 characters long, containing at least one upper case character, at least one lower case character, and at least one number. You must remember your original passcode if you want to change or restore the keychain. Note that the key chain is different from encryption domains.
Note that our existing key chain created in versions prior to 2022.05 can still be used even if it’s shorter than 14 characters. But if you want to change the key chain in 2022.05 or later versions, please make sure the new one is 14 to 20 characters long.

You must create your tenant key chain before one of the following:

  • You add aggregation providers
  • End users order an offering with "Encrypted String" user options
  • You save EWS OAuth secret key

To create your tenant key chain:

  1. Click Create tenant key chain.
  2. Type and confirm your Passcode.
  3. Click OK.

Content security policy

By defining the appropriate Content Security Policy (CSP) directives in the response header, you can determine which data sources are allowed to load by your web application. The CSP directives define trusted sources for content such as scripts, styles, and images. After configuring a policy, content loaded from untrusted sources will be blocked by your browser.

To configure the CSP directive, perform the following steps:

  1. Click Configure.
  2. To add or remove a CSP item, click + Add item or Remove.
  3. Configure the CSP directives as required.
    To add or remove a CSP item, click + Add item or Remove. 
    When you select Remove, all user-defined values will be lost and the SMA default value will be used. 
  4. Click OK.

Encryption passcode expiration

The number of days from the creation of an encryption passcode until its expiration is set as 90 by default. You can modify this setting as needed:

  1. In the Encryption passcode expiration field, select the required number using the arrow buttons.
  2. Click Save.

Encryption passcode warning period

The period to warn the user that the encryption passcode will expire is set as 14 days before the passcode expiration by default. You can modify this setting as needed:

  1. In the Encryption passcode warning period field, select the required number using the arrow buttons.
  2. Click Save.

Encrypt all attachments

Select "On" to prevent the upload of non-encrypted attachments by agents (if encryption has been enabled for the record type).

For more information, see How to encrypt attachments.

Encryption passcode TTL (time to live)

The number of minutes that the encryption passcode can be cached in the browser is set to 60 by default. You can modify this setting as needed:

  1. In the Encryption passcode TTL (time to live) field, select the required number using the arrow buttons.
  2. Click Save.

Enable strong identity validation

The strong identity validation feature is disabled by default. To enable it, follow these steps:

  1. In the Enable strong identity validation field, select On. By default, Off is selected.
  2. Click Save.

Allow strong identity validation bypass for admin

The permission to bypass strong identity validation can't be granted to the tenant admin role by default. To allow the permission for the tenant admin, follow these steps:

  1. In the Allow strong identity validation bypass for admin field, select On. By default, Off is selected.
  2. Click Save.

Enable the extraction of texts from images

If this option is enabled, when you submit requests by using Smart Ticket, the texts can be extracted from the images attached to your request and displayed in the Description field.

By default, this option is enabled.

Enable smart ticket

Smart Analytics can automatically populate fields on Request records based on smart ticket configurations, such as Offering or ActualService, by extracting and analyzing the content you entered in the record.

By default, this option is enabled.

Authorization code TTL (time to live)

The number of minutes that the authorization code is valid after it's sent to the user. The value is set to 1440 by default. You can modify this setting as needed:

  1. In the Authorization code TTL (time to live) field, select the required number using the arrow buttons.
  2. Click Save.

Project portfolio optimization

The ability to view project portfolio optimizations and scenarios is disabled by default. To enable this function, follow these steps:

  1. In the Project portfolio optimization field, select On. By default, Off is selected.
  2. Click Save.

Log user last access time

Select On to save users' last access time to Person records. This timestamp is updated when:

  • The user logs in to Service Portal or Agent Interface
  • A page is reloaded after login

Once a user's last access time is logged, the timestamp will not be updated for 24 hours.

Before you turn on this feature, make sure the Last access time field is added to the Full Person form in Studio.

Export to CSV/XLS with URLs

The ability to include record URLs in the exported file when exporting data from the List view. To enable this function, follow these steps:

  1. In the Export to CSV/XLS with URLs field, select On. By default, Off is selected.
  2. Click Save.

Authorized domains for navigation

The list of approved hostnames for navigation. No warning will appear when a user navigates to the domains in the approved list. You can modify this setting as needed:

  1. In the Authorized domains for navigation field, enter the approved domains as a comma-separated list.
  2. Click Save.

If you want to enable UCMDB browser on the SACM configuration page, you need to add the UCMDB host domain to the authorized domain list before proceeding.

PPO currency

The default currency for Project Portfolio Optimization (PPO) operations is US dollars. To change the default currency, follow these steps:

  1. In the PPO currency field, select the default currency that you want to use.
  2. Click Save.

It's highly recommended to use the same currency for your tenant.

Enable add multiple comments in one save

The ability to add multiple comments to a record before saving the record. To disable this ability, follow these steps:

  1. In the Enable add multiple comments in one save field, select Off. By default, On is selected.
  2. Click Save.

The Add button is removed from the Discussions tab. Only the Add & save record button appears.

When the add multiple comments functionality is enabled, it's not possible to copy multiple comments saved at the same time to related records via a business rule.

Enable On-Call Schedule Management

The ability to view and use the On-Call Schedule Management feature.

By default, this feature is enabled out of the box for new users.

To disable this ability, follow these steps:

  1. In the Enable On-Call Schedule Management field, select Off. By default, On is selected.
  2. Click Save.

When this feature is disabled, it's not possible to view On-Call Schedule Management in the main menu, nor to use any of its functionality.

Enable user notification preferences

The Enable user notification preferences feature is enabled by default. To disable it, follow these steps:

  1. In the Enable user notification preferences field, select Off. By default, On is selected.
  2. Click Save.

Include simulation in debug report

The Include simulation in debug report feature is disabled by default. To enable it, follow these steps:

  1. In the Include simulation in debug report field, select On. By default, Off is selected.
  2. Click Save.

Task/approval parameter evaluation

By default, task and approval parameters are evaluated when the task is created. You can change the setting to evaluate task and approval parameters at the time of execution.

To set the task and approval parameter evaluation time, follow these steps:

  1. In the Task/approval parameter evaluation field, select the Task creation or Task execution.
  2. Click Save.

Run approval plans without cancellation

When set to On, the system always goes through all active approval nodes of each approval plan, even if a node is denied. When set to Off, once a node is denied, the system immediately ends the approval plan and cancels its running approval tasks if any.

This setting does not affect the overall status of an approval plan. Once a node is denied, the status of the approval plan becomes Denied.

Notification service

This option allows you to enable or disable the notification service, which is enabled by default.

Disable notifications for person with selected status

People with selected status(es) will not receive email notifications sent by the system (for example, through business rules or scheduled reports). The status can be Active, Leave of absence, Retired, Terminated, or Inactive. If you have a custom status defined, they are also supported. For a newly deployed tenant, this setting is set to Leave of absence, Retired, Terminated, and Inactive by default.

This setting does not take effect in the following conditions:
  • Notifications are designed to be sent to email addresses. This setting is in the context of the user's status. 
    • For example, User A is an Inactive user. User A's email address is UserA@company.com. If you create a business rule to send a notification to User A, no email will be sent because this setting is taking effect. However, if the business rule is to send a notification to the email specifically, like UserA@company.com or UserA.Email, the email will be sent anyway, as this setting is not taking effect.
    • For example, User A is an Inactive user and is a member of the PDL Group 1. If you create a business rule to send a notification to Group 1, User A still receives the email, as this setting is not taking effect.

  • Email notifications sent by Suite Administration (for example, password reset, and license expiration) and IDM (for example, "forget password" self-service) are not controlled by this setting.

Mail sender name

Set a global sender name for all notification templates. If you leave this field empty, it defaults to "Service Management Automation". If a single notification template has a sender name defined in its "From name" field, the notification template's configuration will be used instead of this global setting. 

Available locales

The languages specified in Available locales are displayed as language options that users can select from the language list in the Service Portal user profile and the Agent Interface user preferences.

By default, no language is selected, which means all languages are available. The English (U.S.) language is always available, no matter whether it's selected or not. For example, if you specify "Deutsch" in Available locales, only "Deutsch" and " English (U.S.)" are available for user selection in the Service Portal user profile and the Agent Interface user preferences.

To specify available locales, follow these steps:

  1. In the Available locales field, select one or multiple languages.
  2. Click Save.

Network Indication Visibility

If set to On, the system pings the client host every few seconds to detect the network speed and displays a warning icon if the round-trip time exceeds the value defined in the "Network indication threshold" parameter.

If set to Off, the system doesn't detect the network speed, and the "Network indication threshold" parameter doesn't take effect.

Enable editing or deleting comments

Turn this setting on or off to enable or disable users from editing or deleting comments.

Customization restriction policy

This setting takes effect on production tenants only. 

Choose Restricted/Not restricted to disable/enable customization on production tenants. 

If set to Restricted, this setting disables customization of the following configurations under Administration:

  • Studio > Studio: all tabs except Approval definitions and Import data
  • Studio > Menu
  • Lists
  • People > Roles

As a best practice in a production environment, set it to Restricted and use the Dev2Prod process to import configuration customizations from a development environment to the production environment.

Enable CTI

With Computer Telephony Integration (CTI) enabled, you can configure Live Support with your CTI system for dealing with telephone support calls.

By default, this option is disabled.

Network indication threshold

This option defines the network indication threshold (in milliseconds). The system pings the client host to detect the network speed. A small warning icon is displayed on the top right corner of the user interface (Service Portal or Agent Interface) if the round-trip time exceeds the threshold.

User reconciliation type

When synchronizing users between Suite Administration and Agent Interface, the system uses the specified setting for user reconciliation.

By default, the user reconciliation type is Login Name.

Enable a custom entity link between two out-of-the-box record types

When creating an entity link, if the source record type is an out-of-the-box record type, its Reference to property is affected by this setting. If enabled, the Reference to property can be any record type. If disabled, only Person, Group, and custom record types can be selected.

Enable a custom association between two out-of-the-box record types

When creating an association (Many2Many), if the source record type is an out-of-the-box record type, its Target record type property is affected by this setting. When this setting is enabled, any record type can be selected as the Target record type. When this setting is disabled, only a custom record type can be selected as the Target record type.

Hide private information of person records

By default, this feature is set to Off. In this case, the full personal information is available to all users.

When set to On, access to the full personal information can be controlled by the role permission settings of the Person record type. To open the private information to specific users, follow these steps:

  1. In the Hide private information of person records field, select On.
  2. From the main menu, select Administration > Master Data > People > Roles.
  3. Select the role to assign the permission to access full personal information.
  4. Under Record Type field, click Add.
  5. Select Person record type, and then select the View permission.
  6. Click OK. The Person record type permission is displayed in the Record Type list.
  7. Assign this role to the users in Agent Interface as required. Users with this role can now access the full personal information.
    The other users without this permission can only access the limited personal information listed below:
    Name
    FirstName
    LastName
    Upn
    Avatar
    IsMaasUser
    ExternalId
    PersonalDetails
    Email
    EmployeeType
    Manager
    Location
    PersonToGroup
    Locale
    IsSystem
    IsSystemIntegration
    EmployeeStatus

Enable the XSS filter

By default, On is selected for the XSS filter. Cross-site scripting (XSS) is a client-side computer attack that's aimed at web applications. Because XSS attacks can pose a major security threat, this security filter is enabled by default, and we don't recommend that you turn off the XSS security filter. But if you want to bypass the XSS filter anyway, you can set the XSS filter to Off.

Enable full character set for regular expressions

This option is set to Off by default, which only allows the use of “?” and “*” metacharacters in regular expressions. When this option is set to On, all metacharacters are allowed in regular expressions.

By selecting to enable it, you are disabling or bypassing security features, thereby exposing the system to increased security risks. By using this option, you understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same. In addition, changing this setting will break all existing match pattern business rules. Please exercise extreme caution.

Recipient allowlist

External email domain allowlist. Enter email domains separated by semicolon. Make sure to enter only the domains, for example, "example.com." Leaving this field empty will stop emails from being sent to any external recipients. On the contrary, entering an asterisk (*) will allow the domain check to be bypassed and may cause potential security risks.

  • An external recipient is represented by an email address in your system. If you want external email domains to receive email notifications, you need to include the domains in this Recipient allowlist.
    Example: 
  • An internal recipient is a user registered in your system. Email domains matching this user will be able to receive email notifications, even without being included in the Recipient allowlist.
    Example: 

This is a global setting that places restrictions on all external emails sent by the system.

Internal emails aren't affected by this allowlist. Therefore, email integration isn't impacted.

Maximum input length

Set the maximum number of characters for multilingual labels. The value is set to 200 by default. The possible length range is 1-2000.

Maximum asset models in tree view

Set the maximum number of asset models allowed in the tree view. The range is 400-4000. If the number of asset models exceeds the maximum number, the system disables the tree view and switches to the table view.

Enable smart virtual agent

By default, smart virtual agent is disabled. Select On to enable the smart virtual agent in Service Portal and customize the settings in virtual agent settings.

Enable Notification History

Select On to enable the Notification History module (Administration > Notification History). For more information, see Notification history

Enable expense line

Select On to enable the expense lines capability. With this feature enabled, the submenus Expense Lines and Cost Allocation in Financial Management, as well as the financial tab on the respective record types, are visible. Expense lines can be generated automatically based on the predefined cost allocation rules or created manually.

By default, this feature is set to Off.

Experience mode

The experience mode is a multi-select field that sets the experience when users work with this tenant. The experience is based on the sum of all modes, and it can partly influence the visibility of the upper functional menu (the lower administration menu isn't considering the experience mode, but the admin access settings instead).

When the tenant is deployed initially, the experience mode is automatically set based on the license assigned to the tenant. If the suite admin assigns an additional license after the tenant is deployed, the system doesn't set the mode automatically, so the tenant admin needs to manually update the experience mode setting as needed. If the suite admin revokes licenses after the tenant is deployed, the system automatically removes the corresponding experience modes that aren't available for the remaining licenses.
 

If the suite admin revokes all licenses, the system automatically removes all experience modes, which means all menu items become invisible in the tenant except Administration > Configuration > Application Settings. After the suite admin assigns a new license to the tenant, the tenant admin can use this menu item to update the experience mode setting. Ignore the "Unauthorized page" message on UI when logging in to the tenant. The message will disappear after the tenant admin sets the experience mode and refreshes the page.

Enable JATO UX

Turn this setting on or off to allow users to switch from classic view to JATO interface. By default, this setting is set to Off.

Enable Service Design and Deployment

By default, this setting is set to Off and is invisible from the UI.
After the suite admin deploys and enables Design and Deploy in Suite Administration, this setting becomes visible and is set to On automatically. You can then decide to keep it on or turn off this feature manually in the tenant.
When the setting is set to On, users with the proper permission can manage Service Design and Deployment by accessing the Design and Deployment Operations menu items from the tenant.

Enable Cloud Cost Reporting

This feature is set to On by default if you have deployed the Cloud Cost Reporting capability under Capability settings for a tenant. Cloud Cost Reporting lets you collect billing data from supported cloud providers and view aggregated cloud costs through prebuilt and custom reports in Operations Cloud. This helps you analyze spending trends, identify major cost drivers, and track cloud usage across accounts and providers.

Enable Customer Service Management (CSM)

This setting is available only for tenants with a Service Management Premium license. Enabling this setting activates Customer Service Management (CSM) functionalities within the Service Management platform.

Default behavior of this setting:

  • For new tenants with a Service Management Premium license, the setting is enabled by default. 
  • For upgraded tenants with a Service Management Premium license:
    • If CSM was not enabled in the version you upgraded from, the setting is disabled by default. 
    • If CSM was enabled in the version you upgraded from, the setting remains enabled.

To change the setting:

  1. In the Enable Customer Service Management (CSM) field, select On or Off.
  2. Click Save.

After enabling CSM, you must complete the post-activation tasks to ensure the CSM features work properly. Refer to the Assign company to users, Update forms, Add business rules, and Add roles sections of the Enable CSM page.

Enable carbon footprint calculation

By default, this feature is set to Off. Select On to enable the carbon footprint calculation, which is used to measure carbon emissions for the IT infrastructure.

Start time of carbon footprint calculation

Set the month and the year when the carbon footprint calculation begins.
Note that this setting is only used for cloud carbon footprint calculation. By default, the start time is set to the month in which the tenant was created.

Enable aggregation

By default, this feature is set to Off. Select On to enable aggregation from other systems. For example, you need to enable this setting so that you can add service providers and add aggregated offerings under Service Catalog Management.

In addition to configuring this setting to On, make sure that:

  • You select at least one of the experience modes available in the current release for the system to display the Administration > Utilities > Providers > Aggregation Providers menu item and the Add an aggregated offering option when you create a new offering. 
  • You create your Tenant key chain before you add Aggregation providers and before end users order an offering with "Encrypted String" user options. Otherwise, you can't save the provider configuration, or the end users can't order an offering with "Encrypted String" user options.

Clean up historical OPB task data from database

Select On to enable a scheduled job that runs daily, which will clean up historical data of completed OPB tasks when the number of task records exceeds a predefined threshold, for optimized performance and stability of OPB. 

Once this option is turned on, the OPB cleanup job start time option is displayed. Select a time from the drop-down list. The cleanup job will start running at the specified time each day. 

Enable purge

Select On to enable the "Purge" feature, which automatically soft deletes records that have been in the final metaphase for a defined period. Please note that purge operations are run through jobs defined in the Data deletion schedule setting.

To use this feature:

  1. Select On to enable the purge feature.
  2. Specify what data to purge:
    • Record types: select one or more record types. Currently, only Request, Incident, Problem, Change, and Release are supported.
    • Purge (soft delete) after being closed for: specify the minimum age of the closed records to be purged. For example, specify 30 days to purge only records that have been closed for at least 30 days. If you specify a value of 0 days, all closed records of the selected record types will be purged. By default, this period is 1 year.

    Notes:

    • This feature currently deletes the records only from the frontend UI and REST API queries, not from the database (that is, the records are soft-deleted from the system).
    • When a record is purged, its attachments, history, tasks, and approval log are also soft-deleted; however, its survey data and related records are still kept in the system.
    • A purge thread can delete up to 1,000 records per record type (Request, Incident, Problem, Change, and Release).  
    • The purge feature always uses the Close time field for this calculation. If you have customized a workflow so that it ends at a custom phase, make sure that the Close time field is set to the correct value.
    • If you have customized a workflow that brings a closed record back to an active state, with a valid Close time value, the record may still be purged regardless of its current state. To avoid it, we recommend that you create a rule to reset its Close time to empty. For example, create the following set field rule during the Leaving event of Request > Support > Done:
      Set Close time to value.
    • The purge job (purge_archive_job) runs asynchronously at the backend as scheduled. Note that if an entity (for example, Request) has one or more Before deleting rules configured (Studio > Request > Processes and Rules > Before deleting), the system triggers the rules before running the purge job.

    Enable hard deletion

    Select On to enable the hard deletion feature, permanently removing purged records. Hard deletion operations, as well as purge operations, are run through jobs defined in the Data deletion schedule setting. Hard deletion is irreversible; make sure the data is no longer needed or that a backup has been created.

    To use this feature:

    1. Select On to enable hard deletion.
    2. Specify what data to hard delete:
      • Record types: select one or more record types. Currently, only Request, Incident, Problem, Change, and Release are supported.
      • Hard delete after being soft deleted for: specify the minimum age of the purged (soft deleted) records to be hard deleted. For example, specify 30 days to hard delete only records that have been purged for at least 30 days. This value needs to be at least 3 days.
    Hard deletion also removes the selected records' task, relation, attachment, comment, notification, history, SLT, survey result, and discussion data from the database.

    Data deletion schedule

    When either the Enable purge or Enable hard deletion setting is enabled, this setting becomes available, allowing you to specify the start time, duration (0-24 hours), and recurrence of both purge (soft deletion) and hard deletion jobs.

    Schedule settings for deletion jobs:

    • Start time: specify the start time in HH:MM format. For example: 01:00 (the job will start at 1:00 am).
    • Max execution time: specify the maximum execution time of the job (default: 1 hour). If there are too many records to be deleted in one job run, the remaining records will be processed in the next job run.
    • Recurs on every: Specify the days of the week to run the job (default: all days of the week are selected).

    Notes:

    • To minimize the impact on system performance, we recommend running these jobs during non-peak hours.
    • If a time zone is specified for the Time zone definition setting on the Application settings page (no time zone is specified by default), the schedule settings are based on this time zone. If no time zone is specified on the Application settings page, the schedule settings are based on the time zone of the system.
    • With the potential for multiple tenants using the same setting to establish schedules, the system can concurrently handle up to 2 tenants' schedules at any given moment. Additional schedules are queued, awaiting the completion of the ongoing tasks. In cases where more than 2 tenants' schedules are set to start simultaneously, 2 tenants' schedules are randomly selected to initiate first.
    • For reference only, a lab test by OpenText indicates that when the system is deployed on one VM (CPU: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2640 v3 @ 2.60GHz 8 cores, Memory: 32GB), it takes about 6 hours to purge 50,000 records.
    • Once a record has been purged or hard deleted, a log entry (maas_purge.log) is created in the<suite global NFS volume>/logs/xservices/platform/itom-xruntime-platform-offline-xxxxxxxxx-YYYY-MM-DD/maas directory.

    Enable User Management Reports

    By default, this feature is set to Off. Select On to enable administrators to view the User Management Reports (UMR) that reflect user role assignments and license usage.

    • The basic information in the LICENSES tab in UMR is available for users who have the View permission for License, no matter whether they're assigned the tenant admin role or not, but the information regarding logged-in users will only be available to the tenant admin.
    • To view the information in the PEOPLE, GROUPS, and ROLES tabs, the users must be assigned with following permissions in their user roles:
      • Record Type: 
        View permission for Person
        View permission for Group
      • Resources:
        View permission for Authorization Principal Resource
        View permission for License
        View permission for License Users
        View permission for Role Resource
      • Administration menu visibility:
        Visible for People module

    Agent interface inherits self-service role permissions

    This setting controls whether to ignore the self-service role permissions for agent users when logged in to Agent Interface:

    • When set to On, agent users are granted both self-service role permissions and agent role permissions.
    • When set to Off, agent users are granted only their agent role permissions. When agent users are logged in to Agent Interface, the system ignores their self-service role permissions and grants the users access to the Agent Interface UI only based on their agent role permissions. 

    By default, this setting is set to Off for newly created tenants and set to On for upgraded tenants.

    • Self-service role permissions refer to the permissions defined in any role without the "Log into the application" permission. The out-of-the-box Self-Service Portal User role is an example self-service role. 
    • This setting takes effect only for access to the Agent Interface UI. Self-service role permissions always take effect for Agent Interface access through APIs, workflows, backend scheduler jobs, or integrations. 
    • This setting doesn't work for the agent mode of the mobile app. 

    Least privilege approach for Service Portal user roles

    By default, this setting is set to Off.

    When enabled, the system will remove all record type permissions from the out-of-the-box Self-service Portal User and Self-service Restricted Portal User roles, and the dedicated Grant default record type permissions for Service Portal usages permission control will provide the least privileges for Service Portal usages to support security hardening for Service Portal users.

    Before you enable this setting, check the following custom roles:

    • All custom roles for agent users who are expected to process requests (such as the Create and Update operations). Add the following record type permissions if missing:
      View permission for Offering
      View permission for Record Category
      View permission for Asset model

After you toggle the Least privilege approach for Service Portal user roles setting, either from Off to On, or from On to Off, perform the following steps to clear the backend cache:

    2. Toggle the Agent interface inherits self-service role permissions option and save, and then toggle it back to the original setting and save again. This save action of this setting will force a clearing of the backend cache. For example, if this setting is set to Off, you need to switch to On and save, and then switch back to Off and save again.

    Enable expert recommendation for ticket handling

    When you view the request/incident details, the system will recommend relevant experts based on the expertise defined in the user profile. You can define expertise by adding skills from the user profile or the Person page. Also, you can add hot topics as users' expertise skills from Hot Topic Analytics. See Expert recommendation for ticket handling settings.
    This feature is disabled by default. To enable it, select On.

    Enable the “Call in Teams” action in the expert recommendation widget

    If Enable expert recommendation for ticket handling is set to On, you can turn on this option to display the “Call in Teams” option when you hover over a relevant expert from the right pane in request/incident details.
    By default, this feature is set to Off. 

    Enable index field configuration for global search

    This setting enables global search for custom record types and custom fields by configuring index fields. When set to On, it allows adding new index fields and enables global search for custom or more out-of-the-box record types.

    Enable the "Contains" search for entity pickers and text filters

    When set to On, the “Contains” search will be the default setting for dropdown lists of entity links/Many2Many associations, text filters in grids/reports, and the "Find" widget for filtering the People/Groups list. When set to Off, the “Starts with” search will be used by default.

    When you search with an entity link or a many2many association, at least three characters need to be entered to start the "Contains" search. The only exceptions are JA, ZH-CN, and KO, where you can enter any number of characters to start the "Contains" search.

    For a newly deployed tenant, this setting will be configured as On by default. For any existing tenants that are upgraded to the current version, the default setting will remain unchanged.

    Integration Studio - Execution logs retention period

    The number of days the execution logs for Integration Studio endpoints are kept. Enter a value between 1 and 90. If a value less than the minimum (1) or greater than the maximum (90) is entered, the system keeps the logs for 1 or 90 days, respectively. The default value is 30.

    Enable language detection for queries

    This setting enables IDOL-based automatic language detection of query strings in global search. By default, this setting is On. 

    If you use one of the East-Asian languages (Chinese, Japanese, or Korean) as the primary language, we recommend toggling off the Enable language detection for queries option and instead using the Primary language setting to specify the language for better search.

    Primary language

    This setting allows you to configure Chinese, Japanese, or Korean as the primary language, enhancing the search engine's ability to understand and interpret search terms. Enabling this feature leads to more refined and accurate search results for East-Asian languages. You can only select one language as the primary language.

    For this setting to take effect, make sure that you disable the Enable language detection for queries option.

    Enable CI detection

    When this setting is enabled, the system automatically identifies CIs as you type in specific text fields of Request, Incident, or Change records, and adds the detected CIs to the 'Involved CIs' section of the record.

    Enable new rich-text editor

    The new rich-text editor provides a better user experience for plain text formatting. 

    You may select On to enable the new rich-text editor in the Agent and Service Portal user interfaces.

    Once you enable the setting for this tenant, you cannot switch it back to Off.

    By default, this setting is set as OFF for the upgrade tenants but set as ON for the new tenants.
    As we do not support to switch back from the new editor to the previous editor, if you export the Dev2Prod package which contains rich-text content from a tenant where the new editor is enabled (such as a new Dev tenant), please do not import the same package to a tenant where the previous editor is used (such as an upgrade Prod tenant).

    Enable cleansing of Exif metadata on uploaded messages

    When the option is not enabled, users can download images from the application and access the metadata of those images, including location, date, device information, and more. For security and privacy reasons, you need to enable this option. 
    Select On to enable the option. Upon enabling this option, users can download images from the application without any metadata information.

    Report loading timeout (seconds)

    This setting enables you to set the maximum time (in seconds) for loading reports in the UI before triggering a timeout. This setting can be adjusted between 15 and 90 seconds. The default value is 30 seconds.

    Number formatting

    Turn on the Number formatting option to apply formatting for INTEGER and DOUBLE data types. Users can enable formatting at the field level for Integer and Double types in both Studio and User Options section. The Enable number formatting check box in both Studio and User Options will be unavailable if the Number formatting option is turned off.

    This setting impacts upgrade behavior and controls the application of number formatting to new, entity, and option fields.

    Category Details
    Upgrade behavior Existing tenants: Defaults to False
    New tenants: Defaults to True
    Entity and Option field behavior When Number formatting is On: It is enabled by default for custom entity and fields in Studio and fields in User Options.
    When Number formatting Off: The field is hidden or unavailable.
    Relation to user preferences User preferences refer to the language settings chosen by the user, which determine the display language for the application interface.
    The system follows number formatting as per the conventions of the selected language.
    Limitations Out-of-the-box (OOTB) field properties are not editable. Users cannot toggle number formatting for these fields. Number formatting is applied for OOTB fields only if the number formatting option in On.

    Time zone definition

    Set the tenant time zone for the Expression Language date formatting function. By default, it's set to the time zone of the client's browser. Only the exported report, DSL expression related with date conversion and Purge schedule involve time zone definitions.

    To set the tenant time zone, follow these steps: 

    1. In the Time zone definition field, select the required time zone.
    2. Click Save.

    Locale setting

    Set the default locale for this tenant for system-generated messages. If the value of the locale setting is empty or invalid, it will fall back to English (US).

    Database reporting

    Database views can be accessed using third-party tools and can be used to perform operations such as data extraction or reporting for Business Intelligence. To avoid system performance issues with massive data queries on a large tenant, it's recommended to access the views from a secondary database node that's synchronized with the primary one. If metadata has been changed, you need to refresh the view manually by clicking the Refresh button in the Database reporting section on the application setting page.

    After clicking the Refresh button, you must grant the database user permissions again. You can do this by running SQL commands.
    In the following example, admin user postgres grants user dashboard_admin database permissions to the database schema 5555000008: 
    postgres=# \c xservices_ems postgres
Password for user postgres:
postgres=# alter role dashboard_admin set search_path = 'view_555500008';
ALTER ROLE
postgres=# \c xservices_ems
You are now connected to database "xservices_ems" as user "postgres".
xservices_ems=# alter role dashboard_admin set search_path = 'view_555500008';
ALTER ROLE
xservices_ems=# grant all privileges on all tables in schema view_555500008 to dashboard_admin;
GRANT
xservices_ems=# grant all privileges on all tables in schema view_555500008 to dashboard_admin;
GRANT
xservices_ems=# grant usage on schema view_555500008 to dashboard_admin;
GRANT
